qas.question: When did the Iranian army push the Iraqis back into Iraq?
When did the Iran-Iraq War finally end?
Who mediated the truce which ended the Iran-Iraq War?
How many civilians in Iran were killed during the Iran-Iraq War?

context: On September 22, 1980, <a0_0>the Iraqi army<a0_0/> invaded the Iranian Khuzestan, and the Iran–Iraq War began. Although the forces of Saddam Hussein made several early advances, by <a1_0>mid 1982<a1_0/>, the Iranian forces successfully managed to drive the Iraqi army back into Iraq. In July 1982, with Iraq thrown on the defensive, Iran took the decision to invade Iraq and conducted countless offensives in a bid to conquer Iraqi territory and capture cities, such as Basra. The war continued until <a2_0>1988<a2_0/>, when the Iraqi army defeated the Iranian forces inside Iraq and pushed the remaining Iranian troops back across the border. Subsequently, Khomeini accepted a truce mediated by <a3_0>the UN<a3_0/>. The total Iranian casualties in the war were estimated to be 123,220–160,000 KIA, 60,711 MIA, and <a4_0>11,000–16,000<a4_0/> civilians killed.
